classification.notes: Primarily used as a cosmetic ingredient (topical). Not an FDA-approved therapeutic drug; product quality and formulation vary by manufacturer.

status.human_use_note: Acetyl Hexapeptide-8 (Argireline) is widely used topically in cosmetic products for appearance-related claims (e.g., reducing the appearance of expression lines). It is not an FDA-approved therapeutic drug, and effectiveness/safety depend heavily on formulation, concentration, and delivery.

risk.rationale: Topical cosmetic use is generally low systemic risk and small human studies report few significant adverse events. Major uncertainty comes from formulation variability (delivery/penetration), heterogeneous evidence quality, and limited long-term data at high exposure.

overview.title: What it is
overview.text: Acetyl Hexapeptide-8 (Argireline) is a synthetic cosmetic peptide used topically in anti-aging skincare. It is marketed for reducing the appearance of expression lines. Proposed effects relate to modulation of neurotransmitter-mediated muscle contraction signaling, but clinical outcomes depend strongly on formulation and delivery to target layers.

observed_exposure_ranges.notes: Descriptive only. Cosmetic formulations vary widely by manufacturer; this entry does not provide usage instructions. Not instructions.

marketed for reducing the appearance of expression lines

evidence.title: Investigating the effects of Argireline in a skin serum (clinical cosmetic study)
evidence.notes: Small human study evaluating wrinkle score changes after several weeks of serum application; reports limited significant adverse events.

evidence.title: Argireline in Treatment of Periorbital Wrinkles (ClinicalTrials.gov)

changelog.summary: Initial canonical entry for Acetyl Hexapeptide-8 (Argireline)
changelog.detail: Added cosmetic peptide entry with human study, review, and clinical trial registry references; low-risk topical profile with uncertainty penalty due to formulation variability and limited long-term systemic characterization.
